page.title: 16Memory.N.Runcton & Middleton
page.content: We asked the same five old people about the changes which had taken place in their villages . One of the Middleton ladies said that the biggest change had been the coming of {electricity}and the{mains water supply. She could remember fetching water from the village pump. All said that the two villages are now much larger, but that village facilities have declined. At North Runcton the school has closed and the bus service was withdrawn three years ago. At Middleton there are fewer shops and local businesses have changed. The wheelwrights shop is now a garage,but that is about to close becuse of declining business. All agreed that they used to shop in Kings Lynn more often than now. For example one now goes once every fortnight instead of once a week.
